Pyrolyzing trash & sewage sludge into biochar is another great biomass energy approach. It cuts landfill use (& tipping fees) way down, doesn't force farmland out of food production, and generally just fills a lot of preexisting municipal needs by doubling as waste disposal.

Biomass is a key slice of renewable energy puzzle. Doesn't just mean biomethane & burning trees (which is what ppl often mean by "biomass energy" rn).

It also can mean, say, turning waste into light, odorless charcoal to save on landfill fees & make energy while you're at it.
